member.name: Overload:Microsoft.VisualBasic.FileSystem.CurDir

member.name: Overload:Microsoft.VisualBasic.FileSystem.Dir
member.summary: Returns a string representing the name of a file, directory, or folder that matches a specified pattern or file attribute, or the volume label of a drive. The My.Computer.FileSystem Object gives you greater productivity and performance in file I/O operations than the Dir function. See My.Computer.FileSystem.GetDirectoryInfo Method for more information.

member.name: Overload:Microsoft.VisualBasic.FileSystem.FileGet
member.summary: Reads data from an open disk file into a variable. The My feature gives you greater productivity and performance in file I/O operations than FileGet. For more information, see My.Computer.FileSystem Object.

member.name: Overload:Microsoft.VisualBasic.FileSystem.FilePut
member.summary: Writes data from a variable to a disk file. The My feature gives you greater productivity and performance in file I/O operations than FilePut. For more information, see My.Computer.FileSystem Object.

member.name: Overload:Microsoft.VisualBasic.FileSystem.Input
member.summary: Reads data from an open sequential file and assigns the data to variables.

member.name: Overload:Microsoft.VisualBasic.FileSystem.Lock
member.summary: Controls access by other processes to all or part of a file opened using the Open function. The My feature gives you greater productivity and performance in file I/O operations than Lock and Unlock. For more information, see My.Computer.FileSystem Object.

member.name: Overload:Microsoft.VisualBasic.FileSystem.Seek
member.summary: Returns a Long specifying the current read/write position within a file opened using the FileOpen function, or sets the position for the next read/write operation within a file opened using the FileOpen function. The My feature gives you greater productivity and performance in file I/O operations than Seek. For more information, see My.Computer.FileSystem Object.

member.summary: Used with the Print or PrintLine functions to position output.
